urls.title: Tackling the toxic legacy of metal mining - Tyne Rivers Trust
urls.description: Metal mines played a major part in Britain’s history, but abandoned mines now pollute our rivers, harm aquatic life and are bad for tourism. The Trust has been working with the Environment Agency and the Coal Authority to tackle the toxic legacy left by these mines. We’ve focussed on using green engineering to prevent sediments […]

tweets.text: @TyneRiversTrust @teesriverstrust @WearRiversTrust ‘Tackling the toxic legacy of metal mining’ These are great partnership projects between @TyneRiversTrust @CoalAuthority @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyYNE tackling the legacy of abandoned metal mines which are polluting our rivers-More here about green engineering: https://t.co/0zYnYow2SD

urls.title: Stop Flushing Wipes - The Rivers Trust
urls.description: As an independent charity, we protect and enhance river environments. We're working with the North West water company, United Utilities, to raise awareness of the environmental impacts of flushing wet wipes down the toilet and we're asking local residents to #StopFlushingWipes.

urls.title: Get involved in the National Waste Crime Survey 2021
urls.description: Farmers impacted by large-scale waste crime are being urged to give their views through a new survey which will aid the fight against criminal activity.

tweets.text: We're asking our members who have been impacted by large-scale waste crime to take part in the @EnvAgency's National Waste Crime Survey 2021. You have until the 22 March to have your say. Visit NFU Online for further details 👉 https://t.co/5lQzDPg2IU https://t.co/06vC4DnTTG

The auction is open! Somerset farmers in the mid & upper catchments: head to https://t.co/v17vaskMnj  to login & bid for funding for a range of different measures that you could use on your land to slow the flow of water and reduce pollution @SRAnews @BristolWater @EnvAgency https://t.co/9arEnJtxTM

urls.title: Car Park Owner Pledges Action After Meeting Held Over Flooding Concerns
urls.description: The owner of a car park in Market Harborough which floods during prolonged rainfall, has pledged to take action in a bid to stop cars getting submerged. It follows talks with Harborough District Council, the Environment Agency and Harborough MP Neil O'Brien, amid on-going concerns about the situa

tweets.text: The owner of a car park in Market Harborough which floods during prolonged rainfall has pledged to take action, after meeting with @HarboroughDC @EnvAgency & Harborough MP @NeilDotObrien -more on Hfm News & here: https://t.co/KQCZKvoBiO https://t.co/Au7nOf4umY
@AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @DaveJonesNuL @CllrTonyK @Sue4AudleyWard Why are the @EnvAgencyMids making excuses for the stink? No investigation, no explanation. What's going on? https://t.co/CbkD4A522O

urls.title: Call of the rewild: releasing Britain's rivers to ease flooding
urls.description: Confining rivers creates valuable agricultural land but can lead to greater flood risk downstream
